question: 이 단어 모양이 맞나요? 처음이나 끝부분을 바꿔야 하나요?
이 명사는 ‘하나’인가요, ‘그것(특정한 것)’인가요? a/an/the 중 뭐가 맞나요?
Example sentences: I’d like a pizza. | I’d like an orange juice. | There is a mirror. | Look at the sky. | Let’s open the door.

question: ‘더 ~’, ‘가장 ~’를 말하려고 하나요? 모양이 맞나요?
Example sentences: Your drone is bigger than mine. | I’m taller than you. | The zebra is older than the pig. | I’m going to join the best soccer team in Argentina. | What’s your favorite subject?

question: 형용사 모양이 문장에 맞나요?
Example sentences: Four small shoes are on the box. | She has eight long legs. | The colorful trees are so beautiful. | I like to read history books. | I like to watch English movies.

question: 형용사를 여러 개 썼다면 순서가 자연스럽나요?
Example sentences: She has long straight hair. | It’s a beautiful sunny day. | You’re very kind. | He has short curly hair. | They’re too expensive.

question: 이 말(부사)이 들어갈 자리가 맞나요?
Example sentences: He can play basketball very well.

question: 이 말(this/that/these/those)은 무엇을 가리키나요?
Example sentences: This egg sandwich is so delicious! | Look at that big fish. | How much are these pants? | Mom, look at those cute gloves. | Look at those colorful boxes!

question: 이 말(some/any/many/much/a few 등)은 양이나 수에 맞나요?
Example sentences: Here’s some paper. | Do you want some juice? | Do you have any crayons? | Did you see any animals? | I will read many books.

question: 이 말(my/your/his/her/our/their)은 누구의 것인가요?
Example sentences: My name is Tom. | What’s your name? | Science is his favorite subject. | I’m waiting for my sister. I have her umbrella. | Today, let’s talk about our favorite subjects. | Dogs are looking for their toys.

question: 이 말(each/every/another 등)은 뜻에 맞나요?
Example sentences: I exercise every day. | We play badminton at school every morning. | I play soccer with my dad every evening. | I eat fresh fruits and vegetables every day.

question: ‘~의’(’s)처럼 표시가 꼭 필요한가요? 없어도 되나요?
Example sentences: It's Inho’s. | It is my grandpa’s hat. | We’ll visit the art center. | I’m going to take a guitar lesson. | Welcome to the Animals’ Sports Day. | I’m going to write my name on my friends’ T-shirt.

question: 하나인가요 여러 개인가요? -s를 붙여야 하나요?
Example sentences: Whose glasses are these? | Four small shoes are on the box. | There are two chairs. | Whose socks are these? | Put on your socks and shoes, please.

question: 이 말(this/that/these/those)이 무엇을 가리키는지 분명한가요?
Example sentences: What’s this? It’s a ball. | This is a tiger. | That’s the first airplane. | What are these? They’re buttons. | What are those? They’re maps.

question: myself/each other 같은 말이 필요한가요? 모양이 맞나요?
Example sentences: Help yourself. | You can see yourself and the city around you.

question: someone/anything 같은 말이 뜻에 맞나요?
Example sentences: Hello, everyone. | In the end, everyone is safe. | Is there anything fun? | I want to buy something for my brother. | The tree gives everything to a boy.

question: mine/yours 같은 말이 필요한가요? 아니면 my/your가 맞나요?
Example sentences: It's mine. | Is this yours? | Yes, it’s mine. | Mine is green. | It’s not mine.

question: I/me/he/him 같은 말이 자리(앞/뒤)에 맞나요?
Example sentences: Where is Lucas? I can’t find him. | She’s my sister, Kate. ... Oh! She’s tall. | Look at them! Cows and ducks. | There are three dogs. May I touch them? | Can you tell us about your day?

question: who/which/what 같은 말이 여기서 맞나요?
Example sentences: What time do you get up? | What time do you go home? | What time do you have breakfast?

question: it/this/they가 무엇을 가리키는지 헷갈리지 않나요?
Example sentences: Look at the tree. It’s very tall. | I caught a big fish and cooked it for dinner. | What are these? They’re buttons. | Whose glasses are these? They’re Yuna’s. | This is my dad.

question: do/be/have/can 같은 말이 필요하나요? 모양이 맞나요?
Example sentences: I can play the violin. | You can put your things in the basket. | I can help you. | I can't wait. | We can go now.

question: 동사 끝부분(-s/-ed/-ing)이 맞나요?
Example sentences: I’m making a piano. | My bird is flying. | He’s playing the janggu. | I’m looking for my brother. | It’s raining outside.

question: 주어가 하나인가요? 동사에 -s가 필요하나요?
Example sentences: I have many friends in my class. | He lives in Korea now. | We have many classes today. | I work with farm animals. | It is very nice.

desc_en: Finite vs non-finite form selection error
question: to ~ / ~ing 중 무엇이 맞나요?
Example sentences: I like to make new things. | I like to play the piano. | I like to read books. | I love dancing very much. | I like singing songs.

question: 이 일은 언제 일어난 일인가요? 과거/지금/앞으로 중 뭐가 맞나요?
Example sentences: I went on a trip. | I visited my grandfather. | I ate delicious food. | I took a walk on Ollegil. | We bought a beautiful dress.  | | I’ll visit my cousins. | I will join a space camp. | I will make a robot. | I will learn Spanish. | I'll be a gardener in San Diego.

question: ‘누가 했다’인가요, ‘~당했다/되었다’인가요?
Example sentences: Van Gogh painted it. | Yi Sunsin built the ship. | Shakespeare wrote the story. | It is made with Hanji. | I’m interested in history.

question: 품사를 헷갈리지는 않았나요? (사물을 나타내는 말, 사물을 꾸미는 말, 행동과 관련된 말을 꾸미는 말 등)
Example sentences: The tiger cried sadly. | Listen carefully. | This is a present for healthy children.

question: 이 형용사 뒤에 오는 말(to/that/명사 등)이 맞나요?
Example sentences: Nice to meet you. | Good to see you again.

question: 이 형용사 뒤 전치사(in/on/at 등)가 맞나요?
Example sentences: I’m interested in history. | I’m interested in science. | I’m interested in art.

question: 이 부사 뒤 전치사(in/on/at 등)가 맞나요?
Example sentences: It’s next to the toy shop. | It’s next to the bookstore. | Turn right at the corner. | Turn left at the bus stop.

question: 이 명사 뒤에 오는 말(of/to/that 등)이 맞나요?
Example sentences: It’s time to go home. | It's a day for reading.

question: 이 명사 뒤 전치사(of/in/on 등)가 맞나요?
Example sentences: It’s time for breakfast. | I have no ideas for the school festival. | It’s a book about stars.

question: 이 명사는 셀 수 있나요? a/an, -s가 필요한가요?
Example sentences: I want some water. | I want some milk. | I like apples.

question: 이 전치사 뒤에 오는 말(명사/~ing 등)이 맞나요?
Example sentences: Thanks for helping me. | Thanks for joining Willy’s quiz show. | How about riding the bikes together? |  I’m good at playing soccer. | I’m interested in baking.

question: 이 동사 뒤에 오는 말(to/~ing/that 등)이 맞나요?
Example sentences: I want to be a pilot. | I’m going to bake cookies. | I like making robots. | I’ll go fishing with my dad.

question: 이 동사 뒤 전치사(to/on/for 등)가 맞나요?
Example sentences: I'm listening to music. | Look at this picture. | I learned about trees.

question: and/but/or 중 어떤 게 뜻에 맞나요?
Example sentences: I like fruit salad and pizza. | Science is fun, but it’s not my favorite. | He likes bulgogi and tteokbokki. | Art, music, English, and science. | I will play and plant trees with my friends.

question: on the other hand/in addition 같은 표현이 뜻에 맞나요?
however/therefore 같은 말이 뜻에 맞나요?
Example sentences: Science is fun, but it’s not my favorite | Also, we can see colorful trees. | Then, I go home at two o’clock. | So, I’m helping Rosetta.

question: because/when/if 같은 말이 필요한가요?
Example sentences: I like spring because I can see the beautiful flowers. | I’m angry because my brother broke my robot. | I’m worried because I have a math quiz. | I’m very happy because I’m going to see a soccer game.

question: 이 표현이 영어에서 자주 쓰이는 말인가요? 더 자연스러운 말이 있나요?
여기서는 쉼표/마침표를 써야 하나요, 아니면 and 같은 말을 써야 하나요?
단어 순서가 자연스럽나요?
Example sentences: Where is my phone? | How old are you? | Don’t run, please.

question: 불필요한 단어가 있나요? 빼도 뜻이 같나요?
틀린 건 아니어도, 이 말이 자연스럽나요? 더 흔한 말이 있나요?
